rules.ruleString: Must be enrolled in course version {2116}

unitName: Advanced Clinical Psychology: Child, adolescent and family
description: The focus of this unit is on clinical assessment and intervention/management in the field of child and adolescent clinical psychology.  Commensurate with the advanced training context of this unit, the content will include a sequence of topics which extend the topics included in the Introductory unit which all students complete in Year 1 (see Clinical Developmental Psychology DSY5105).  This Unit will include complex child and adolescent case presentations by senior clinicians in the field.  Students will also be required to present cases which relate to their clinical training in the Doctorate program.  In addition some specific topics such as: trauma, critical incidents, the use of projective assessment techniques, and group therapy, are included in the seminar topics.  Students are expected to demonstrate their knowledge of these areas in their clinical case discussions and written assessment tasks.
faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Nursing and Health Sciences
